) Change to Title. Changed title from Partnership Control System (PCS) to Pass-Through Control System (PCS). PCS is used to manage S-corporations as well as partnerships. Pass-through is more reﬂective of the systems function. (

) Editorial changes made throughout. Updated terminology used, and removed italics from titles. Changed Campus TEFRA Function (CTF) to Campus Pass-through Function (CPF). Spelled out use of acronyms. Updated name changes to applicable forms and letters.

Change to Title. Changed title from Partnership Control System (PCS) to Pass-Through Control System (PCS). PCS is used to manage S-corporations as well as partnerships. Pass-through control is more reﬂective of the systems function.

Editorial changes made throughout. Updated terminology used, and removed italics from titles. Changed Campus TEFRA Function (CTF) to Campus Pass-through Function (CPF). Spelled out ﬁrst use of acronyms. Updated name changes to applicable forms and letters.
EFFECT ON OTHER DOCUMENTS

This material supersedes IRM 4.29.5, dated 11/27/2017. Changes to this IRM will also affect the Pass- Through Entity IRM 4.31 Sections 1 through 8. That IRM is currently being rewritten and will include the changes contained in this IRM.
Field and campus personnel working TEFRA and ILSC pass-through entities and/or their investors.

Notices and Cover Letters
) This Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) section provides an explanation of different notices available through the Partnership Control System and (
) Purpose: This IRM is to describe the Pass-Through Control System generated notices and settlement letters. (
) Audience: Field Examination Revenue Agents (RAs) and campus RAs, Compliance Offers (TCOs), Tax Examiners (TEs) and Clerks working through entities and/or their investors linked on the PCS. (
) Policy Owner: Director, Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE), ters, Examination - Field and Campus Policy (SE:S:E:HQ:EFCP) (
) Program Owner: Program Manager, Campus Examination and Field (SE:S:E:HQ:FCP:CEFS) (
) Primary Stakeholders: SB/SE, Large Business and Industry (LB&I), and Appeals (

) Program Goals: PCS is a database used to create an electronic linkage between pass-through entities and their underlying partners. Linking in instances is mandatory. Linkage allows for the proper control of statutes ensures all relevant partners are processed. (
) Contact Information: To recommend changes or make any other related to this IRM section, see IRM
, Providing Feedback About IRM Section - Outside of Clearance. (

) PCS was created to monitor and control pass-through entity investors. through entities can have many partners and many levels of tiering. occurs when an investor in a pass-through entity is also a pass-through This complexity can make it difficult to keep track of statutes and monitor the investors. (

) PCS control is a policy that was established in response to the provisions of the Tax Equity and Fiscal Responsibility Act (TEFRA) of has been expanded to cover other pass-through entities that fall outside TEFRA. (

) The Director, SB/SE, Headquarters, Examination Field and Campus (SE:S:E:HQ:EFCP) is responsible for: or a. Coordinating and implementing PCS enhancements; b. Coordinating resolutions for PCS systemic problems; and c. Updating this Handbook. (

) The SB/SE Program Manager, Examination Field and Campus Policy, Exam & Field Support (SE:S:E:HQ:EFCP:CEFS) is responsible for: a. Ensuring that PCS procedural changes and computer program are implemented and coordinated with area office and campus tion personnel; and b. Monitoring and evaluating area office and campus examination PCS quality control procedures. (
) Internal Revenue Manual
TEFRA/ILSC Notices and Cover Letters 4.29.5
This Internal Revenue Manual (IRM) section provides an explanation of the different notices available through the Partnership Control System database.
Policy Owner: Director, Small Business/Self-Employed (SB/SE), Headquar- ters, Examination - Field and Campus Policy (SE:S:E:HQ:EFCP)
The SB/SE Program Manager, Examination Field and Campus Policy, Campus Exam & Field Support (SE:S:E:HQ:EFCP:CEFS) is responsible for:

Ensuring that PCS procedural changes and computer program are implemented and coordinated with area office and campus tion personnel; and Monitoring and evaluating area office and campus examination PCS quality control procedures.
Pass-Through Control (

) Field Territory Managers, Field Area Directors, Director over LB&I Ogden Director, Examination - Brookhaven, are responsible for ensuring that: a. An accurate database is established by designating PCS and activities; and b. A PCS quality control system is implemented. This includes timely on PCS record establishments, PCS reports, and AIMS TC
Reject Registers. It also includes timely processing of TEFRA notices and Appeals settlement letters (campus only). (
) Area office Examination Managers and campus Field Support Operations managers are responsible for: a. Maintaining an updated copy of IRM

, Pass-Through Control (PCS) Handbook, in their respective functions; b. Ensuring the training of technical and clerical employees in PCS proce- dures; and c. Establishing PCS records and acting on PCS reports in a timely to assure an accurate PCS database. (

) The campus PCS Coordinator works with: • The other PCS coordinator(s) • Technical Services TEFRA Coordinators • Their local employees • Other campus functional areas to ensure timely processing of PCS related activities (
) The campus PCS Coordinator is charged with: • Identifying and resolving technical problems • Identifying and coordinating the resolution of PCS systemic problems (

) Following are speciﬁc campus PCS Coordinator responsibilities: a. Coordinate PCS operations among areas, Campus Pass-through Functions (CPFs), and other campus functions; b. Ensure timely processing and distribution of PCS output; c. Ensure that all requests for establishment and linkage on PCS are reviewed for accuracy, completeness, and timeliness; d. Maintain accuracy of the PCS database by ensuring that action and reports are worked in required time frames; e. Resolve AIMS problems; f. Assist in the training of examination personnel in PCS procedures and system; g. Establish and update CPF and Appeals parameter ﬁles; h. Review completed Form
, PCS Notice Parameters, prepared by CPF; i. Create, load, print, proofread, and edit parameter ﬁle data using Form

, PCS Notice Parameters; j. Coordinate with Computer Systems Analyst (CSA) whenever a change is made to parameters; k. Review and input all campus Command Code (CC) Mass Change (MSCHG) and linkage deletion (TSDEL) requests; l. Coordinate requests for PCS IVLs with campus computer services and requesting function.
4.29 Pass-Through Control System
Field Territory Managers, Field Area Directors, Director over LB&I Ogden and Director, Examination - Brookhaven, are responsible for ensuring that:

An accurate database is established by designating PCS responsibilities and activities; and A PCS quality control system is implemented. This includes timely action on PCS record establishments, PCS reports, and AIMS TC
Reject Registers. It also includes timely processing of TEFRA notices and Appeals settlement letters (campus only).

Following are speciﬁc campus PCS Coordinator responsibilities: a. Coordinate PCS operations among areas, Campus Pass-through Functions (CPFs), and other campus functions; b. Ensure timely processing and distribution of PCS output; c. Ensure that all requests for establishment and linkage on PCS are reviewed for accuracy, completeness, and timeliness; d. Maintain accuracy of the PCS database by ensuring that action and reports are worked in required time frames; e. Resolve AIMS problems; f. Assist in the training of examination personnel in PCS procedures and system; g. Establish and update CPF and Appeals parameter ﬁles; h. Review completed Form
, PCS Notice Parameters, prepared by the CPF; i. Create, load, print, proofread, and edit parameter ﬁle data using Form

, PCS Notice Parameters; j. Coordinate with Computer Systems Analyst (CSA) whenever a change is made to parameters; k. Review and input all campus Command Code (CC) Mass Change (MSCHG) and linkage deletion (TSDEL) requests; l. Coordinate requests for PCS IVLs with campus computer services and the requesting function.

Pass-Through Control (
) PCS generates all TEFRA notices to TEFRA notice investors. (
) Procedures for processing these notices are contained in IRM
, Pass- Notices Through Entity Handbook. (
) The sub-sections below discuss the various notices required by the statute, and the various notices provided for administrative proceedings. Notice (

) PCS CCs TSLOD and TSNOT are used to generate notices. CC TSLOD is (TSLOD and used to establish investors on the PCS database, and will generate a Beginning of Administrative Proceeding (NBAP) with the proper deﬁner. CC TSNOT will generate a variety of notices depending on the deﬁner used. generation of the different notices is explained in the following sub-sections. (
) Form
, PCS Notice Generation, is used to generate TEFRA investor notices (

b. To generate notices, the key case and investor records must both be present on PCS. c. In addition, the investor must be linked to the TEFRA key case and investor’s TEFRA indicator must be present. d. If there is a one-year assessment statute date present on the linkage, letter will not generate for the investor. (
) Notices and forms which can be generated by PCS are: a. NBAP, b.

-Day Letter (investor settlement package), c. FPAA, d. Appeals Settlement Letter for non-docketed cases with affected items, all linked investors, e. Appeals Settlement Letter for non-docketed cases, to all TEFRA investors, f. Appeals Settlement Letter for docketed cases, g. Form

-Z, TEFRA Partners’ Shares of Income, h. Tax Matters Partner (TMP) Settlement Letter i. Investor Level Statute Control (ILSC) Pass-through Audit Notiﬁcation Letter, and j. Administrative Adjustment Request (AAR)

) After the partnership is established on PCS, CC TSCHG must be used to the address of the partnership. The address is needed for the generation of investor NBAPs. CC TSCHG items
and
will be used to enter the partnership address information. (
) Review all NBAPs to insure the partnership address was correctly printed within the body of the letter. If no address was printed, a new letter must be generated manually. (

) The NBAP notices are sent by regular mail. The CC TSLOD generates two Mail Lists: a. One listing is sent to the area or Appeals Processing Manager as proof of mailing of the notices. The other listing is ﬁled in a permanent reference book, not in the administrative ﬁle, as was previously done. The need for this information usually comes about after the key case ministrative ﬁle was destroyed. (Exhibit

–PT, and any applicable attachments are generated for each investor. Two copies are mailed to the investor, one a customer service in case the taxpayer ﬁles a petition, and one copy is ﬁled the key case administrative ﬁle. (

) The FPAA notices are sent by certiﬁed mail. Input of CC TSNOT, notice type also generates three Certiﬁed Mail Lists: a. Version A (two copies): One listing is sent to the area or Appeals Pro- cessing Manager as proof of mailing of the notices. The other list is in a permanent reference book, not in the administrative ﬁle, as was viously done. The need for this information usually comes about after key case administrative ﬁle was destroyed. (Exhibit
) b. Version B (one copy): This list is certiﬁed by the post office and to the CPF as proof of certiﬁed mailing. (Exhibit

) The no change FPAA is generally used to no-change a TEFRA case after initial

day period. It is also used when a taxpayer believes there are ments in their favor, but the Service does not agree. The No-Change FPAA allows the taxpayer to petition the court regarding the adjustments. (
) For an electing large partnership a Notice of Partnership Adjustment is the document instead of an FPAA. Large – Final (

Pass-Through Control (
) The docket number and TMP name and address must be present on the case record for PCS to accept a request for notice type
It is extremely important that the literal “Tax Matters Partner” is NOT included as part of TMP name.
) The functionality of generating the schedule of adjustments via PCS has (

) removed. The campus or PTE should use a copy of the schedule of adjust- Schedule of ments provided by the ﬁeld when sending notices to investors. Sending the Adjustments copy eliminates any transcription errors that can occur when inputting that in PCS for the purpose of having PCS generate the schedule.
) The Form
-Z is a listing of all investors linked to a particular key case. (
) form lists each investor with their name, address, TIN, and Schedule K-
Form
–Z, Partners’ income/loss percentage. Shares of Income (
) Subsequent Form
-Z may be generated via CC TSNOT, notice type Z.
) Letter
is generated to all investors using notice type “A”. (
) The Letter
is used when the TMP ﬁles an AAR requesting substituted AAR
-Day Objection treatment. The law requires all partners be given the opportunity to object to Letter, Letter

the partnership changes if those changes will result in additional tax to The letter is generated to all linked partners. If a partner objects, a tion needs to be made as to whether that partner is subject to an and therefore allowed to object. (
) See IRM
for more information of substituted AARs.
) The Letter

4.29 Pass-Through Control System
The Letter 2513, TMP Settlement Notiﬁcation Letter, provides the TMP with list of investors that have entered into a settlement agreement.
The letter and list of investors are generated weekly and includes investors that have had a settlement date input with CC TSCHG during the prior week

) The letter is not required by law, but was created to inform investors when examination is beginning. This way, the investors ﬁrst contact from us will be an audit report or a request to extend the statute. (
) It is recommended that the letter be issued to all investors controlled by the campuses, and all ﬁeld controlled investors that may not be aware of the through examination. (
) The letter should not be sent by certiﬁed mail. (

) PCS will generate the letter by using CC TSLODK. The CPF will send to all partners if requested when the linkage package is submitted. CC TSLODK is also used to issue the NBAP on TEFRA investors. PCS the PICF Code of
on the ILSC key case and will generate the appropriate Letter

) PCS will automatically suppress any notices that would normally be to investors in a disaster area. Investors in a disaster area receive a Due code on their module. The disaster code is set based upon the taxpayers code. (
) Notice suppression will not apply to FPAAs (CCs TSNOT
or TSNOT
) If CC TSNOT encounters a disaster code on a partner record, an error condition will occur with “DI” in column

on the terminal, and a displayed that a disaster code exists for that partner. Alternately, the may over-write the “DI” with “OV” to override the suppression, and TSNOT then transmit the request. ) Each notice contains several parameters that can be changed using Form
, PCS Notice Parameters. The Form
is used to change the letter- head and signature information. (

is also used to add or change the employee contact information. (

address. Employee Contact Information 5 Employee Indicator 4 positions. The ﬁrst position must be 1.
